steps.section: COLLECTION OF WHOLE BLOOD

steps.section: COLLECTION OF WHOLE BLOOD
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f17u1","text":"After obtaining informed consent from family and/or patient, collect blood sample into EDTA tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"714j5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF WHOLE BLOOD TO PBMC CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7to3e","text":"First, take 100µL whole blood and place into a pre-labelled tube for downstream single cell analysis, such as flow cytometry detailed herein from step 16.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF WHOLE BLOOD TO PBMC CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9tsmn","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in 3mL RPMI 2% FCS.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF WHOLE BLOOD TO PBMC CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"736r8","text":"While the mononuclear cells are spinning, harvest the granulocyte layer at the interphase between the erythrocytes and the Ficoll solution and place into a labelled cryovial. Add 1mL of RNAlater solution to the collected granulocytes and pipette mix thoroughly. Immediately transfer the granulocytes to   for long-term storage. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dqmvq","text":"There is an option here to harvest granulocytes for downstream analysis, including genomics, which we have detailed below. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: PROCESSING OF WHOLE BLOOD TO PBMC CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f4t90","text":"Once the spin is complete, carefully aspirate the mononuclear layer at the interface between the RPMI 2% FCS and the Ficoll solution into a new 15mL tube. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2a8mr","text":"Aspirate plasma layer and store in 2mL cryotubes, then transfer to   for long-term storage. steps.section: PROCESSING OF WHOLE BLOOD TO PBMC CELL SUSPENSION
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3hn4v","text":"Prepare cell suspension for cell counting. Here, we use trypan blue and a Bio-Rad TC-20 cell counter. Take 10µL of the cell suspension and place into a microcentrifuge tube for cell counting. Add 10µL of trypan blue to the microcentrifuge tube and mix thoroughly. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF PBMC
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8pfjd","text":"Discard supernatant and resuspend cells at a ratio of 1:1 in RPMI 2% FCS and freeze solution (heat-inactivated FCS + 15% DMSO) such that cells are frozen between 1-10 million cells/mL. Transfer cells to cryogenic vial.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46jb1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16q0f","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5e28j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ek2j5","text":"If performing downstream single cell analysis on PBMC, prior to adding freeze solution is where you can allocate out the required number of fresh PBMCs.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: CRYOPRESERVATION OF PBMC
